instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor to components that create power rails for the GPU. .

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message:
Hi everybody,
I'm working on a retina board for a graphic issue at the begining
So I reflowed the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> and after that at first boot fan for 3 seconds then stop and now nothing,

I checked

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> between 17 and 18 = 3.5Ω
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> between 27 and 28 = 21.5Ω
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> PIN2 = 20V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 1.67volts
PPDCIN G3H = 20,43v
PP3V42 G3H = 3.43v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 0.851v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0.455v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3,3v

I can't find a solution for this board I can try to replace <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> but do you think that this component can cause this ?
Or something else is burned now ?  I used a Chinese adapter so perhaps that have nothing with <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>

Thanks for help

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 1.67volts

Should lead you to think you have either a short on that rail or the ISL is bad...

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message:
Yes I will try to change it,
but I have also
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 0.851v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0.455v

So I have to change Both ISL <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> ?

Or this problem can be caused by <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> as it's the only thing touched on this motherboard before this failure.

Thanks for help

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message: Resistance to ground on PPBUS? If <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> was messed with, this could be bad.

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message:
The resistance on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 19Ω
The <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> seems to have been resoldered correctly when I check on the microscope everything seems to be perfect.

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message:
Do you get the same value (as <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>) on any big coil (from secondary supplies)?
You can also lift F7140/41 to see where the low value remains.
Do not power up the board again, untill find the culprit...

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message:
Ok so I have changed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and problem is the same
Green light and orange light with no fan.

I've Lifted F7140 and 7141 and resistance to the ground of <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 16.4Ω

Where are the coils from secondary supplies ?

Thank you really much for help.

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message:
So I removed <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>

When I remove <RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR> the short is still there on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with 17.8Ω

and not anymore on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>

But I've a short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> => 18.6Ω
There is a short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER3V3_ISNS</SIGNAL> => 19Ω
There is a short on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL> => 20.7Ω

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message: Measure resistance from PPBUS to all coils starting with L9330. I bet there is a 0 Ohm short there.

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message:
Hi Duke thanks for your answer, you're right, I checked and there is a short between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to L9330 I found 0.5 Ohm
What's the solution ?

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message: Replace <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q9330</TRANSISTOR>/31 and pray the GPU wasn't killed by the 12V it got.

threads.title: Retina 15" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green/Orange Light on Magsafe no fan
threads.message:
ok so I replaced <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> + Q330/31 The fans was spining, no shorts anymore, so I tried to reput the board into the computer , and again no fan , with the same short than before.
I don't understand how it's possible.
Do you have an idea Duke ?
